 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָרִיס‎</span><sub>45</sub> **noun masculine** ==eunuch== (Late Hebrew ***id.***, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָרִיסָא‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (all with verb denominative = ***emasculate***), Old Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סרסא‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>331</sup> [[BDB#Cook|Cook]]<sup>86</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (verb <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be impotent***), [[BDB#Kam|Kam]] [[BDB#Frey|Frey]] (not [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]); probably foreign word; according to [[BDB#Jen|Jen]]<sup>ZA vii. 174</sup> = Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šarêši***</u></abbr> (***rîši***), ***he who is the head, chief***, compare [[BDB#Brock|Brock]]<sup>Lex 239 b</sup> [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 694</sup> (***ša-riš*** ?), [[BDB#Zim|Zim]]<sup>ZMG liii. 1899, 116</sup>; ***eunuch*** being specialized meaning; in any case Arabic is Aramaic loan-word); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> [[1Kgs.22.9|1Kgs 22:9]] + 7 t.; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְרִיס‎</span> [[Gen.37.36|Gen 37:36]] + 3 t.; plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָרִיסִים‎</span> [[2Kgs.9.32|2Kgs 9:32]] + 17 t.; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְרִיסֵי‎</span> [[Gen.40.7|Gen 40:7]] + 4 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָרִיסָיו‎</span> [[Gen.40.2|Gen 40:2]] + 4 t., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָרִיסֶ֫יהָ‎</span> [[Esth.4.4|Esth 4:4]] — ***eunuch***, of Pharaoh [[Gen.37.36|Gen 37:36]]; [[Gen.40.2|Gen 40:2]]; [[Gen.40.7|Gen 40:7]] (all [[BDB#E|E]]), married [[Gen.39.1|Gen 39:1]] ([[BDB#R|R]]<sup>JE</sup>); of Israel kings [[1Sam.8.15|1Sam 8:15]] (predict.), [[1Kgs.22.9|1Kgs 22:9]] = [[2Chr.18.8|2Chr 18:8]]; [[2Kgs.8.6|2Kgs 8:6]]; [[2Kgs.9.32|2Kgs 9:32]] (all of Northern Israel); [[1Chr.28.1|1Chr 28:1]] (in David's time). [[2Kgs.23.11|2Kgs 23:11]]; [[2Kgs.24.12|2Kgs 24:12]]; [[2Kgs.24.15|2Kgs 24:15]] compare [[Jer.29.2|Jer 29:2]], also [[Jer.34.19|Jer 34:19]]; [[Jer.38.7|Jer 38:7]]; [[Jer.41.16|Jer 41:16]] (all in Judah; so likewise) [[2Kgs.25.19|2Kgs 25:19]] (military officer) = [[Jer.52.25|Jer 52:25]] of Babylonian kings [[2Kgs.20.18|2Kgs 20:18]] = [[Isa.39.7|Isa 39:7]] (predict.); ascribed to Nebuchadnezzar in Daniel, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רַב סָרִיסָיו‎</span> [[Dan.1.3|Dan 1:3]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׂר הַסָּרִיסִים‎</span> v[[Dan.1.7|Dan 1:7]] v[[Dan.1.8|Dan 1:8]] v[[Dan.1.9|Dan 1:9]] v[[Dan.1.10|Dan 1:10]] v[[Dan.1.11|Dan 1:11]] v[[Dan.1.18|Dan 1:18]] to king of Persia in [[Esth.1.10|Esth 1:10]]; [[Esth.1.12|Esth 1:12]]; [[Esth.1.15|Esth 1:15]] + 9 t. Esther; promises made to eunuchs [[Isa.56.3|Isa 56:3]]; [[Isa.56.4|Isa 56:4]]. (Term never used in law codes; on contrary compare exclusion of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא‎</span>, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּרוּת שָׁפְכָה‎</span> [[Deut.23.2|Deut 23:2]] [see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>on the passage</sup>], also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְרוֺחַ אָ֑שֶׁךְ‎</span> [[Lev.21.20|Lev 21:20]].) — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רַבסָֿרִיס‎</span> is title of high military officer [[2Kgs.18.17|2Kgs 18:17]] (Assyrian ), [[Jer.39.3|Jer 39:3]]; [[Jer.39.13|Jer 39:13]] (Babylonian ). — See further, [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] [[BDB#Smith|Smith]]<sup>DB Art.</sup> ***' Eunuch, '*** [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Gen.39.1|Gen 39:1]]</sup> [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>[[Deut.23.1|Deut 23:1]]</sup>.
